meanings.definition: The highest or climactic point of something, especially as reached after a long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The culmination of the race was when the winner crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The concert's culmination was the singer's final high note that left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the culmination was when everyone started dancing on the tables!
meanings.sent4: The culmination of the play was the dramatic reveal of the main character's true identity.
meanings.sent5: The culmination of the fireworks display was a breathtaking explosion of colors in the night sky.

meanings.definition: The act of reaching the highest point or final stage of something.
meanings.sent1: The team's hard work led to the successful culmination of their project.
meanings.sent2: The culmination of the meeting was the decision to move forward with the new proposal.
meanings.sent3: The culmination of the baking competition was when the judge accidentally tasted salt instead of sugar!
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the culmination of the day brought a sense of accomplishment to everyone involved.
meanings.sent5: The culmination of the journey was the breathtaking view from the mountain's summit.
